SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.enterprise_architecture.essential.widgets
Class HttpReportServiceClient

java.lang.Object
  com.enterprise_architecture.essential.widgets.HttpReportServiceClient

public class HttpReportServiceClient
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulate the actual Service request using HTTP.
Used by the ReportServiceClient class to make the request in a worker thread.
From version 3.0, support for HTTP form-based login is provided. As form-login is a very human-user oriented approach, to support implementation, a login failure page, must contain the phrase "Login - Error", e.g. even in a comment.
Similarly, in order to recognise a Form Login page, the phrase "Login" must appear in the page for the login form. These phrases are controlled by the itsLoginErrorPhrase and itsFormLoginPhrase attributes that can be controlled by a property in the 'host' application.

Since:
v1.0
Version:
3.1 - Tuned rendering and transmission of images for large sets
, 3.0 - Added progress tracking and switches on sending of images
, 2.3 - Fixed empty image bug and included timestamp in XML snapshot (02.11.2010)
, 2.2 - Added sending of GraphWidget images to Viewer.
Author:
Jonathan W. Carter

sendReportXML

public boolean sendReportXML()
Send the XML for the report to the reporting service. Updated to v4 of Apache HTTP Client pack and to add compression - JWC 22.10.2009

Returns:
true if sending the report was successful, false if there was a problem.

sendImages

public boolean sendImages()
Send the set of images, one for each GraphWidget, to the reporting environment. A separate service is used to receive these (separate to the report XML service).

Returns:
true if sending all the images was a success, false if there was a problem.
Since:
version 2.2

Parameters:

Since:

compressXML

private void compressXML()
                  throws java.io.IOException
Compress the report XML using GZIP and send the results to the itsCompressedXML variable to reduce the load on the stack from passing large data entities about. itsCompressedXML is a ByteArrayEntity ready to be loaded into the HttpPost body as binary/octet type.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
Since:
version 2.1
Author Jonathan Carter

createAndSendImage

private boolean createAndSendImage(edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Cls theClass,
                                   edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Slot theSlot,
                                   org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultHttpClient theHttpClient)
Create the image for all instances of the specified GraphWidget and send them to the reporting service. 27.10.2010 JWC - Fixed empty image bug.

Parameters:
theClass - the class that has a slot that uses a GraphWidget
theSlot - the slot that uses a GraphWidget
theHttpClient - the Http connection that should be used to send the created image @since 3.0
Returns:
true on successfully creating and sending the image, false otherwise.
Since:
version 2.2

sendGraphImage

private boolean sendGraphImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage theImage,
                               java.lang.String theFilename,
                               org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultHttpClient theHttpClient)
Send the supplied BufferedImage to the reporting environment, Essential Viewer, as a Multi-part MIME so that the instance name can be send with the compressed PNG image as a tuple.

Parameters:
theImage - the image to send to the service
theFilename - the name of the image file that should be created on the reporting service * @param theHttpClient the Http connection that should be used to send the created image @since 3.0
Returns:
true if successfully sent the image, false otherwise
Since:
version 2.2
